meanings.definition: Tending to concentrate or focus one's attention or effort.
meanings.sent1: She has a concentrative mind that helps her solve puzzles quickly.
meanings.sent2: The student's concentrative study habits led to improved grades.
meanings.sent3: His concentrative nature during hide-and-seek always makes him the champion.
meanings.sent4: The concentrative beam of light from the lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The concentrative power of the microscope revealed tiny details unseen before.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the act of concentrating or focusing.
meanings.sent1: The concentrative athlete never loses sight of the goal during a match.
meanings.sent2: Her concentrative painting style captures the essence of nature beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The concentrative chef never burns the food, even when multitasking.
meanings.sent4: The concentrative energy of the sun fuels life on Earth.
meanings.sent5: The concentrative force of gravity keeps planets in their orbits around the sun.
